modules.description: Processes message routing between components using unique identifiers. Operates on string-based messages and opaque ID tokens to establish and manage communication channels. Enables asynchronous message passing where a component can receive a message with its associated ID and forward it to a specified destination.

Handles real-time monitoring of ZeroMQ socket events by receiving and returning event data as a deferred value. Operates on ZeroMQ socket objects and event structures. Used to track socket state changes and network activity during distributed system operations.

Routes messages between components using string payloads and opaque IDs, enabling asynchronous communication and dynamic channel management. Monitors ZeroMQ socket events in real time, returning event data as deferred values for reactive system behavior. Supports tracking of network activity and state transitions during distributed operations. Can be used to build responsive message brokers or event-driven network applications.

Processes zero-copy message exchanges over ZeroMQ sockets, supporting multipart messages and frame manipulation. Operates on byte sequences, message frames, and socket endpoints with asynchronous I/O. Enables real-time data streaming and low-latency communication in distributed systems.

Routes messages using string payloads and opaque IDs, enabling asynchronous communication and real-time monitoring of ZeroMQ socket events through deferred values. Tracks network activity and state transitions, supporting dynamic channel management in distributed systems. Allows construction of responsive message brokers or event-driven applications by handling message routing and event propagation. Provides operations for sending, receiving, and tracking messages, along with event-based state updates.
